review.reviewBody: I haven't used the bag yet but I'm already obsessed with it.  I bought it to be a summer bag for when it's too warm for my WM TerraLite and as a liner/overbag for when I need a little extra warmth.  It's packs so small and it's so light!  Both bags plus my pillow fit in a 12L stuff sack.  Backcountry.com's product info shows the regular length at 60 in. and the long at 65 in.  This is incorrect!  Based on the info, I ordered the long - I'm 5'8" and wanted it to come up past my shoulders.  The long is actually 78" (from the drawstring at the foot to the top of the bag).  I called customer service and explained the situation to Pat.  He sent me a return authorization and expedited a regular bag out to me as a replacement.  It measures 72" and it's perfect!  One item to note is that the zipper only works from the outside of the bag - not a problem for me as I appreciate the trade-off to reduce weight.    Like other reviewers, I love WM's bags - this is my 5th (my two daughters have the other 3).  I have no need to spend my money on any other brand.
review.name: Obsessed with bag but wrong description!

name: Everlite Sleeping Bag: 45F Down

review.reviewBody: I bought a small and large bottle for my Surly Bridge Club. Both fit nicely. They keep my water and ice cold all day although my mountain climate is on the milder side.
review.name: Lightweight and keeps water cold

review.reviewBody: This is the best biking water bottle I have ever purchased. The water flows naturally without the need to squeeze because of the air straw that Bivo created to cause an optimal flow. Biking with a vacuum sealed bottle is a game changer in south florida as the water stays cold, a novelty in florida summers. Lastly, the bottles fit perfectly in my "Most" brand water cages and have a non-slip coating for a good grip. These Bivo bottles are the best!
review.name: Best biking water bottle ever!

review.reviewBody:
Loved my regular Bevo, so I got this one for my brother.
He's riding an XL Marin full suspension E-mountain bike, and it doesn't fit, which is a bummer, but it is still getting used off the bike so not a loss. Just be warned this insulated version might not fit a full squish frame.
review.name: Nice, but not for mountain bike frames

review.reviewBody: I have used the Podium Chill bottles for the past 13 years and that is all I have known.  I'm used to having luke warm water 1.5 hours into my ride.  Not with these!!  I have found that I cant fill the bottle with ice because there is way to much ice left over.  I fill the bottles only half full of ice and that is more then enough for a two hour ride.
review.name: Ice cold water all the time

review.reviewBody:
Just now starting to warm down here but these guys are already delivered as advertised. They do have a fast flow, so don’t even worry about not being able to squeeze the bottle. 
They have a slightly different shape, so existing bottle cages might not grab it as well as a plastic bottle.
review.name: Ice Cold Road Water in Houston

review.reviewBody: Love the fast flow spout that you can open with your teeth (if you want to). Keeps liquids cold for my 2-3 hour rides. Fits perfect in my bottle cages. What else would you want in a bike bottle? Get one or like me get 2. Highly recommended!
review.name: Great Bike Bottle!

review.reviewBody: Super fast flow rate needs some getting used to. Great insulation keeps liquid cold
review.name: Great bottle keeps liquid cold

review.reviewBody:
Love these bottles. I've put this thing through its paces for the past few months and it's my go-to on the bike now. I also just use it for daily hydration off the bike.

Here's what I love:
- Flow rate is effortless (takes some getting used to honestly).
- Vacuum insulation keeps liquids cold just as long as other insulated bottles.
- Nice universal fit with all of my bottle cages.
- Comes with cleaning kit.

Downsides
- One of these weighs the same as two Purists or Podiums. Not for those of us trying to save grams.

#BackcountryGearheads #CompetitiveCyclistGearheads
review.name: Excellent Concept, Even Better Product

review.reviewBody: This bottle is my new favorite bottle for biking! Keeps my water cold for multiple hours, has a nice grippy feel to it so I don't drop it while on the go, AND when the top is pulled open the water just flows out super easily (no need to suck the water out like a traditional bike bottle). They also sent 2 screws to replace current ones on my water bottle cage that are low profile so they don't scratch the bottle. Highly recommend!
review.name: Amazing Water Bottle

review.reviewBody:
I've used this bottle for 4 rides now, and while it does take a bit to get used to the inability to squeeze, having cold water for the duration of a long ride is a game changer. The water flow is excellent, taste is great, and the bottle itself is super light. As a bonus, it comes with two low profile screws (if needed) for your existing water bottle cage if the current screws are getting in the way. 

#backcountrygearhead
review.name: Excellent Bottle for Biking

name: Bivo Trio 21oz Insulated Bottle

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the Squad XL in December of 23 with my own money in the blackout color way with additional clear and everyday rose gold lenses. I mainly ride on Mt. Hood, but tour all over the PNW. After 93 days this season using these goggles, I can safely that this has been my favorite goggle purchase to date. My favorite aspects of the goggle, are the wide field of view, quick lens changes, and the clean look. The lenses cover a range of conditions from cloudy and rainy to blue bird and feel like Im living in 4k. The goggles are comfy on the face, but can ride around on face. Also, if you ride with them lower on your brow line, Ive found my cheeks get a bit uncomfortable. The goggles pair flawlessly with the method, but I also used my POC helmet and found the fit to also be virtually seamless. They are also lightweight, block wind, ventilate excellently, and frankly make my vision better than my regular ole eye balls. 
For the negative. I haven't really been able to wear these under a helmet. Could be the additional harness on the back of the method in conjunction with the goggle strap. Not a big deal. 
Lenses can fog heavily between lenses when stored. A few back to back mornings, Ive gone to change lenses and found that my clears or blue lenses are all fogged up on the interior of the lens. Super annoying cause then I'd have to either not use the optimum lens, or gently warm the lens up to clear the field of vision. 
Lens changes can be tricky as the sides are pretty stiff. This gets easier the more you get the hang of it. Perhaps a slight bevel on the sides would make lens instillation a bit easier.
Included bag with my pair seems cheap when compared to the goggle. Perhaps a hard case or zip case standard?
Overall: I would recommend these as they're a lot of goggle for the price, especially if you can get them on sale.
review.name: My honest review after 93 days in the PNW

review.itemreviewed: Rekon Wide Trail Dual Compound/EXO/TR 29in Tire
review.reviewBody: Wasted more time, just bought a Rekon and a Forecaster and both wobble (rims are true and bead is set). Just more defective products from Maxxis to waste my time. I recommend switching to another brand if you don't want to be as angry as me right now.
review.name: MAXXIS WOBBLE AGAIN!

review.itemreviewed: Rekon Wide Trail Dual Compound/EXO/TR 29in Tire
review.reviewBody:
I love this tire!!

In the 2.6. it reminds me of the old Geax Segauro - supple, tough casing and a fast rolling, grippy contact patch. From Utah desert moon dust to high alpine hero dirt this true has been fast climbing and provides a surprising amount of downhill traction. I run these front and rear on my trail bike and am constantly surprised at how hard I can push them. 

The taller side knobs (relative to other XC tires) hook up really well. These are great flow trail tires and just rip. They are no mud tire, but have better wet traction than I expected and shed mud surprising well. An absolute great all-rounder, especially in the wider size. Can’t recommend enough. 

Would be a great tire for riders in dryer climates or those who want something between XC and trail tires. I almost hate to use the term, but it’s like the perfect downcountry tire.
review.name: Such a weird, great Utah tire

review.itemreviewed: Rekon Wide Trail Dual Compound/EXO/TR 29in Tire
review.reviewBody:
Use cases:
Salsa Timberjack hardtail w/120mm fork, 40mm internal rim (29x2.6)
Canyon Neuron full suspension w /140mm front, 130mm rear, 30mm internal rim (29x2.4)
Surly Karate Monkey with Lauf fork, 40mm front and 35mm rear internal rim (29x2.6, 29x2.4)

Trails:
Mostly eastern Kansas, some Arkansas, Colorado, Utah, Missouri, New Mexico

Me: 5’10”, 200-210 lbs., early 40s

I’m a chronic tire tester, and this is my go-to tire.  It rolls fast enough, and is a good blend of traction, speed, and durability for the trails I ride.  

The Rekon isn’t the lightest, fastest, grippiest, or toughest tire, but it’s the best blend.  It’s the one I recommend if someone asks.  EXO/TR, 60 TPI is my first choice, although I have the EXO+ and 120 TPI versions.  They are all good, I just find the 60 TPI and EXO/TR are the best blend of function and value.

Our trails in eastern Kansas are more XC than anything with roots and rocks.  It needs to be tough enough to withstand the full gamut of sharp rocks, hard hits descending over roots and through wet and rocky draws, as well as put up with goatheads here and there.  

I like that Maxxis tires don’t tend to dry rot over time (my bikes are all stores indoors).  I’ve got 5 year old Maxxis tires that are still intact and the treads are solid and they still function well tubeless, goathead thorns and all.
review.name: My go-to tire

name: Rekon Wide Trail Dual Compound/EXO/TR 29in Tire
Rekon Wide Trail Dual Compound/EXO/TR 29in Tire

review.reviewBody: They are super cute online, and on TikTok do not get me wrong. In person they look long and clunky and I ordered a kids 5. They are very cute but I know I will hate them when they crease and they had already started to on the first day. The strap is cute too but too long and does not look appealing if not worn around the ankle. Like I said cute but I ended up returning for a refund unfortunately. I also haven't bought a pair of Uggs in a long time and always go with a classic short. The quality has gone down significantly since they are no longer UGG Australia. I am so disappointed, they look cheap.

review.reviewBody: The color is great! I will say the sizing is a tad bigger than usual. Also, can only wear with strap around the back of foot. It's too long to flip on top and has a large gap which looks weird. I got a kids size to save a few $ but I've seen others say the strap thing is only on the kids sizes.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Cane Creek Helm MKII 29in Boost Fork - Limited Edition Aurora online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Helm MKII 29in Boost Fork - Limited Edition Aurora
review.reviewBody:
I never even heard of Cain Creek until the other day. I picked up a Specialized Stumpjumper E-bike  from a dude that couldn’t ride it anymore. The front shock was Rockshox and honestly I’m surprised they put their name on that piece of junk. I’m a fairly aggressive rider doing large rock drops, dusty trails and steep root covered climbs. So I need a shock I can trust. My e bike is about 60lbs, I’m 5’10” 200 riding lbs. So after a 15% discount I bought the limited edition MKII 29er.
 About a week later it arrived and I took it to my local bike guy who installed it with 1 spacer and set up the settings for me. I took it out for a solo test ride and I was impressed. I hit a small rock feature about 2’ tall with about a 70 to 80% incline, I hit it with a fair amount of speed and it completely compressed the shock, I don’t think it bottomed it out but I rolled over it like a champ! 
Long story short I strongly recommend the shock and Cain Creek has a new fan.
review.name: MKll limited

review.itemreviewed: Helm MKII 29in Boost Fork - Limited Edition Aurora
review.reviewBody: Upgraded from a Fox38 because the 38 was so harsh. Big improvement. The fork absorbs a lot more impact while still feeling solid and supportive. Front end feels lighter and has a lot more feel. Handling is sharper.
review.name: Makes Fox look like junk

name: Helm MKII 29in Boost Fork - Limited Edition Aurora

review.reviewBody: The helmet is fine poc makes good stuff backcountry has the helmets incorrectly listed there are only sm md lg xl not sm/xs m/l ect I ordered a md/lg and it’s just a medium so be careful when ordering it here the med is a bit small for me but it’s not worth the hassle of trying to return it cause they don’t have a lg anyway
review.name: Size listings are incorrect
comment: Thanks for pointing out the sizing discrepancy here. We have alerted the website team to get this updated and sent you an email to follow up.

review.reviewBody: Got it for my son. Fits well, uses it for mtn biking and skate boarding.
review.name: Good fit, good price

review.reviewBody: Been wearing this helmet for my daily ride for the past 6 weeks or so, and it's been great. It fits me very well, with no wiggling around, and it's probably the most comfortable helmet I've ever owned. It's been surprisingly comfortable even on those hot days when it's 90+ degrees. Love it.
review.name: Love this helmet.

review.reviewBody:
I’ve used the Poc Crane helmet for about 5 years. This has been exclusively my BMX and dirt jumping helmet. It’s light, comfortable, vents well, and looks good. Well, tonight I finally “used” my helmet for the first time in 20+ years of riding BMX trails (aka serious dirt jumping). My front tire high sided a berm, and I instantly went down straight to my face. The impact was ferocious. Knocked me out for a few seconds, and cracked my Poc Crane right in half. I feel that the MIPS played its part, because the way my face and forehead impacted generated a lot of rotational forces. I feel that this helmet saved me tonight from a more serious brain injury, and I couldn't be more grateful for it. After getting driven home from the jumps by my wife, I logged right into BC.com and am re-purchasing this lid. 

To all the kids out there who still ride BMX or skate without a helmet, put one on! Only get 1 brain.
review.name: Excellent Lid

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, comfortable, and adjustable for a secure fit.
review.name: Good Helmet

name: Crane Mips Helmet

review.name: Good design but lacking in quality

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket as a light weight stuffable jacket for hikes that might be cold or are a cold start. I’ve only had it about a week but have been hiking with it in the Sonoran desert every day multiple times a day on a hunting trip. This jacket is everything I was hoping for. Warm, and able to be packed down easily. And it looks good to! Reversible is nice. Discrete black or flashy multi colored. Ether way, nice jacket
review.name: Light weight and warm!

review.reviewBody:
This rain jacket is super impressive. When it comes to traveling, camping, hiking, or even exploring new cities, countries, etc. You can't beat the portability of this jacket. It is super thin and light making it easy to roll up and store into any type of bag weather it's a backpack, purse, or even large fanny pack. 

Even for being so light and thin, it easily stops water from getting through. I've had zero issues with any type of moisture getting inside either due to prolonged periods of water exposure or leaks through any seals and stitching. 

I will say, because it's so thin, in colder weather, you would need a warmer layer underneath to act as insulation. That being said, you might need to get one size up than normal so it can fit over any layers you need.
Also, if you are traveling through any thick brush or scraping up against rocks, you need to be careful about scraping or snagging any sharp/rough surfaces too hard to prevent any micro/macro tears in the material. Being so thin, it's not super durable, but it's not very easily torn either.
Overall fantastic product and highly recommend
review.name: Ultra light travel jacket

review.reviewBody: Bought this jacket through a pro deal program when working at a climbing gym, as I wanted a packable, lightweight rain jacket for travel. I typically love OR's gear (and it's always good to support a local Seattle company) but I was sorely disappointed by this jacket. It packs down small and folds into the pocket, which is nice, and is fairly breathable, but that's about it. The jacket is not waterproof whatsoever- about 5 minutes in normal rain and I was soaked. A thick hoodie does a better job keeping you dry than this flimsy thing. Furthermore, the too-skinny arms make it impossible to put over any other kind of jacket or sweater, and the dinky elastic cuffs and lack of hand warmer pockets make the garment impractical and cheap feeling. I hope OR discontinues it to maintain the integrity of their brand.
review.name: Decent windbreaker, terrible raincoat

review.reviewBody: Super light and packable. It kept me nice and dry when needed. I found it runs small if you intend to put it over layers, recommend size up over a puffer  like nano puff.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: I'm soaked. wet through very quickly in light snow and rain
review.name: I'm Wet

review.reviewBody:
got my boyfriend the jacket in the Hot Ember red, and he absolutely loves it! it really is FOUR jackets in One due to the reversible liner. we live in Yosemite between 4000 and 8000ft and are outside every day in winter, often it is between 3F and 15F and this jacket keeps the cold out! and he looks amazing in it, he is new to the mountain life so im trying to teach him he needs proper gear, lol and with this jacket and some Kuhl pants and salomon boots,  he looks like he knows what hes doing now, LOL. I bought myself the Patagonia Snowbelle 3 in 1 for myself as i needed a new 3 in 1

  as to size, its one of the few things that fit him well! he is a serious weightlifter and has huge chest/shoulders and arms but narrow waist and the XL fit him very nice
review.name: boyfriend LOVES it!

review.reviewBody: Overall jacket looks and fits great as would be expected from Patagonia.  I was shocked by the speed and accommodation of backcountry.  I usually wear a L in everything, but the L in In this jacket was much too big.  I utilized the chat feature to initiate an exchange, which took less than 10 minutes.  The crazy part was my new jacket was here in 3 days.  All around great experience.
review.name: Great Deal

Great jacket. It's soft and has a good cut in the arms, shoulders, and hood. 

These reviews should come in 9 months. Haven't had it snag on twigs, wash it, test the zipper. Basically, durability testing.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: I purchased this to use as a light shell for backpacking. It was intended to be used in occasional light rain, wind, and is a layer piece. I haven't yet tested it in any rain but it worked great for a layer piece and is is as light as they come.
review.name: Ultra light shell

review.reviewBody: I bought this for running on cold days but ended up using it on the skin track this winter. I really enjoy how lightweight it it - perfectly insulating as I warm up while not creating a sweat factory. Whenever I want to take it off I can just stuff it my bibs pocket.
review.name: Lightweight & Breathable

review.reviewBody:
If you're 5'8" then a bad sizing/cut ruins an otherwise good lightweight windbreaker. The torso length on size Small is way too long unless you're 6'1. That's a strange design choice because really just how many 6'1" dudes are going to be wanting to buy a size small? 

If I could cut off the bottom 3-4 inches of the jacket it would fit well. As it is, the length makes it look super goofy. And the bottom opening is narrower than it should be, despite the waist and chest fitting great.

So yeah, if you're 5'8" and a bit under 150lbs, don't buy this jacket. The otherwise decent jacket is ruined by the disproportionately long torso on size S. I really hope Black diamond updates the proportions on the size small for next year's model. 

The other critiques are more minor. The front chest pocket isn't very clean of a design, it takes away from the overall look. And the front full length zipper material is too stiff for the lightweight material. 

Aside note to Back Country - The 'Product Fit' Feedback dropdown treating fit as if it's 1-dimensional doesn't help. The fit is okay width wise, but too long. The option 'Runs large' makes me think baggy, not necessarily too long.
review.name: Bad sizing for 5'8"

review.reviewBody: I always throw this in my pack for multi pitch climbing. It weigh nothing and takes up no space. It will stay dry in light rain but anything else, your getting wet. I also bring it running when the weather is questionable. You can fold it up small enough to shove in a running fanny pack.
review.name: Ultra lightweight wind layer.

review.reviewBody: I'm 6'4" and normally wear an XL. This fit perfectly and I can layer it with some light clothing.
review.name: Great shell!

review.reviewBody: It is good for only wind not rain it is perfect jacket for spring
review.name: That Awesome Jacket is too Lightweight and it can pack in the pouch

review.reviewBody:
This review is for one 35 and one 38 model. The 35 tire I received had a mfg defect resulting in a large wobble after being properly installed. Returned as "defective" before use (I love Backcountry for their ease of returns).
Also note, these tires measured very narrow and not true to size. The 35 measured at 32.23 (with digital calipers) at its widest point when aired up to the lowest recommended psi unweighted and the 38 I ordered measured slightly over 35.
review.name: Measures narrow, 1 tire (defective)

review.reviewBody: The streets here around PDX can be pretty torn up, with debris of all kinds scattered everywhere. Regular road tires are faaar too hard and smooth to handle anything but the pretty lanes downtown or out in the West burbs.  Swapped out those stiff-jacket tires years ago for the widest tires that would fit my forks and frame to give a bit more cushion for the busted pavement, with just enough knobs to prevent sliding around on all the sand, gravel, broken glass, and smashed plastic we see out past the hills.  Been working great so far, with a nice smooth roll at modest pressures.  Only time will tell about longevity, but they've been great so far.
review.name: Great for poor roads

review.reviewBody: 700x38 light & supple - They mount easily (even with just a floor pump) they ride smooth on pavement, grip great on a wide range of gravel surfaces, not so wonderful in the mud, but they're not intended for that, & look sharp - I got around 3K miles on them on varied surfaces & I don't recall having had a single flat. Couldn't be happier. I have them on a Niner RDO-RLT Carbon with Stan's Grail S1 wheelset & it feels like they were meant to be together.
review.name: Near Perfection

review.reviewBody: I've ridden these on all sorts of mixed terrain (including some ice) and I love how sure footed this makes my bike feel. These are pretty fast rolling too, I never feel I'm pushing harder than expected. I haven't set these up tubeless but plan to in the future. Initially getting them onto the rims was a bit of a challenge but once installed were easy to get on and off after that.
review.name: Greater than expected!

name: Cannonball Tubeless Tire

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: They are the most comfortable of all my walking shoes. Thank you
review.name: My Hoka Shoes

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This was my third pair of Hokas...Clifton's, Biondis and now the Challenger. I couldn't wait for them to come in....then they did, and I put them on...and almost immediately something in my knees felt funny. So I took them off and waited for the lock laces and it wasn't so bad...thinking they were maybe too tight and using the wrong socks. They feel really RIGID. Yesterday, I took the longest walk and I could not wait to get home, and I wanted to chop my left foot off because it hurt so bad. This morning, I put my Biondis on and all is well again...wow. Too late to return and it really sucks because I love the new color combo, but I just can't wear these any more.
review.name: Love the colors...but these kill my foot and knees

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Only shoes I buy for all my endurance events and every day for that matter! Worth the money - my feet always thank me! :)
review.name: Love these shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These fit a bit smaller than my Clifton’s — I had to go up a half size. Overall, they’re great so far. I walked in dewy grass with them for 5 miles and my feet stayed dry. I bought them for a PNW trip I’m going on this fall and feel confident they’ll keep me dry then too.
review.name: Great shoes

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: There is no way these shoes are Gore Tex, my feet were soaked, so disappointed in the quality for the cost, Hoka's arent what they used to be.
review.name: defective..?

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Good sneakers. Good for walking. I wear 9 and ordered 9. They feel a bit too big. Have used them twice and walked total of 6 miles.
review.name: Good choice

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these because I loved the color, when I put them on, I was skeptical, but when I took them out for a walk, I was very impressed with the soft comfort, like walking on pillows and I can feel the support and stability! I'd recommend these and will be ordering a couple others styles that are meant for just walking! I waited a year to purchase, as I just loved the color I'd chosen, I wish I'd gotten them sooner☺️
review.name: Most comfortable sneakers I've ever worn

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I use the Challenger 7 GTX for all my hikes. Did two 13 mile plus hikes in them and they are great. I wish they'd bring back more colors. I may try the Stinson, but I like the waterproof feature on the Challenger I recommend them to my girlfriends
review.name: I love these shoes

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Like they are rugged & waterproof; but the worst foot feeling to wear during the rainy season. Feet feel miserable. My other Hoka are better.
review.name: Hurt Your Feet

review.itemreviewed: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Since my doctor told me I had plantar fasciitis I searched for a shoe that would give me pain relief from my feet and knees. I tried hoka and have been a proud wearer every since. The soles of these shoes are like little clouds from heaven. Hoka is now my go-to shoe.
review.name: Proud hoka owner

name: Challenger ATR 7 GTX Running Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the Thule Aion Carry On Spinner online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Aion Carry On Spinner
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Aion Carry On Spinner online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this item for remote travel in the Arctic. This luggage is on and off multiple planes and rolls across snow and ice covered tarmacs very well.  I chose the Nutria colour so that it will stand out. I like that when I unzip the luggage it only unzips the top portion and not in half, makes it easier going through security and getting items out of the suitcase.  It has exceeded my expectations.
review.name: Robust

review.reviewBody: Love this carry on bag.  The larger wheels are an excellent idea and beneficial for longer walks / treks from airport and train stations    I’m glad I chose this color.   It makes my bag stand out and it’s  unique   I wish the cross body bag and packing cubes were in stock because I’d buy them too
review.name: Great size and quality for a carry on bag

review.reviewBody: I love this bag! I had my eye on it for a while before I purchased and I am so glad that I finally went ahead and bought it. I work in the outdoor/active industry and travel for work fairly often. For the last several years I have been using a patagonia black hole duffel as my primary carryon and I am SO glad to finally have a wheeled suitcase that feels professional and functional and still kind of outdoorsy. The greenish color is sort of like a tan waxed canvas and it feels very "heritage brand" in person. I love the way the pocket on the front looks, but I quickly realized that it isn't functional for sliding my laptop in and out. That is the only thing anywhere close to a complaint. Highly recommend it.
review.name: Cute, functional, spacious

review.reviewBody: Just returned from two weeks travel with the Thule Aion 4-wheeled spinner carry on. It worked well in every circumstance including travel over cobblestone streets and sidewalks. The importance of the larger wheels in the back (when using in two-wheel mode) quickly became obvious. The larger wheels traveled much better over cobblestones than the suitcase would have using smaller wheels. Then when on smooth ground in the airport, the four wheel spinner configuration worked perfect. The handle is well made and sturdy and adjusts to the lower position for four wheeled use easily. The included packing cube was useful for reducing volume of bulky items stored flat like sweaters or some pants. Very much enjoyed using this suitcase and it appears it will be quite durable.
review.name: Performance in a carry on.

review.reviewBody: The bay is awesome. The handle feels like it’s from a cheap bag. Very wobbly. I would have thought for 400, a very solid handle would be the minimum bar. Compares to some 50 bags. Bay is a 5. Handle is a 1. Blend to 3.
review.name: Great Bag Not Sure About the Handle

review.reviewBody: We've taken 3 trips with our new Thule luggage and are very impressed. I have never invested in quality luggage before even though we travel a fair amount for business and pleasure. I just always bought some combo set from a warehouse store and used them till they wore out or broke. Sometimes that didn't take too long. This is obviously not going to be the case with our new Thule products. Extremely well built and awesome looks! The spinners practically push themselves they glide so smoothly. The backpacks and boarding bags are cavernous. They all have so many great features and storage options. Thule quality has me convinced that good luggage is worth the investment.
review.name: Awesome Carry On and Looks Cool

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was so pumped when I got this bag! The color was a nice green. The wheels are so smooth and go easily in any direction. The material of the bag is great quality. The different storge compartments in the carry on are awesome! There is a cool compartment for toiletry items. I got many compliments at the airport with the look and quality of this carry on. Perfect size. Couldn't be happier with this product.
review.name: SIck Carry On!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got the Aion Carry On Spinner from Thule for all the different trips i make throughout the year. This is the best Carry on i have ever owned, it is made so strong, looks good, its easy to pack. I love the extra see through pouch that you can attach inside the carry on, its prefect for toiletries. The wheels make it easy to go through the tight aisle in a plane with the wheels moving any ways you need them.. and the handle adjust to the height  you need.
review.name: The best Carry on i ever owned !

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Thule Aion carry on is the perfect luggage for the short business trips I take. The size is just right. The putter fabric is very durable and water resistant. Inside, there are some zipper compartments and a removable bag for dirty clothes. I’ve never had much luck in the past with spinner wheels, but these work great! They are very smooth and easy to maneuver. Now I have to buy one for my husband!
review.name: The Perfect Carry On!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was a little concerned with the description of waxed canvas for this. Instead it is a very heavy duty water resistant fabric that is still light weight. The wheels, zipper and handle all feel nice and solid. Thule is a solid brand and I am not disappointed!
review.name: Really good quality and thoughtful features

name: Aion Carry On Spinner

review.reviewBody:
THE BRAIN/TOP IS NOT REMOVABLE ANYMORE. For me, who always took it off to save the extra weight, this completely ruins the versatility of bag. 

Added features are adjustable backside, pull out waist adjustment, and integrated rain cover. I would rather not have the added tech on the back and waist, just more things that can malfunction, and quite a bit of added weight. 

This bag is purely for weekenders now, and can no longer be tailored to those putting in long miles.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Platypus Reservoir Cleaning Kit online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This does not fit inside my hoser platypus bladder.

The description for this product should tell which bladders this item is and isn't with.
review.name: Brush does not fit inside the hoser platypus bladder!!!!!

review.reviewBody: Does a good job cleaning my reservoir. Nothing fancy just does what it’s supposed to do, well.
review.name: Does a good job cleaning

review.reviewBody: It's great, cleans my reservoir, would be better in a carrying case than those small things that keep It's shape
review.name: It's great, cleans my reservoir,

review.reviewBody: The larger brush used to clean the reservoir seems robust enough, but the coiled brush bent and then snapped off during my first time using it. I figured this might be a defect but I submitted a return request and have not heard anything for almost 2 months. It seems like most kitchen brushes could be used for the main reservoir so without the coiled brush I would recommend buying something from your local grocery store.
review.name: Small Brush Broke Immediately

review.reviewBody: The brush to clean the hose worked well, but the brush to clean the reservoir itself didn't actually reach into the corners of the reservoir, so it was ineffective at getting it clean.
review.name: One brush worked well, the other, not so much

review.reviewBody: Essential for keeping your reservoir clean and sanitary. Without it, there's no real easy way to clean the tube. I wouldn't own a hydration reservoir without it.
review.name: Essential

review.reviewBody: Great for backpacking with your dog, much easier than using a pump to fill multiple bladders and bottles.
review.name: MSR never disappoints...

review.reviewBody: The brush for the reservoir was easy enough and did its job. I wish the end was a little longer to get inside where it depresses for the tube connection but nothing I couldn't actually get myself. I actually bought this kit for the tube cleaner but I didnt even get to use it fully. The bristles immediately started to come apart before I put the end in the tube. I decided to go for it anyways thinking a couple of lost bristles wouldn't hurt but the entire end broke off! Dont waste the money and just put your pack in the freezer instead to avoid bacteria build-up!
review.name: Tube Cleaner is Worthless

review.reviewBody: Recent camping trip to Northern Mich area... the platupus system worked well... this cleaned the system well...
review.name: yes .. a must for the system

review.reviewBody: The brushes work great, The problem is, the hose and bladder take many days to dry, and in the meantime, the remaining water gets funky, so I haven't solved the funk problem. If you guys could add in similar tools with sponges instead of brushes, that would solve the problem. I would consider changing to a bladder than has an opening that I can get my hand inside of, but I only like the plastic that platy uses - it doesn't taste like anything. Thank you!
review.name: Missing a drying component

name: Reservoir Cleaning Kit

review.reviewBody: When it's time to stop digging through your institution's/outfitters's fleet of incomplete kitchen totes with random crusty tools from decades ago, consider this set for one-stop shopping. It has pretty much all the tools I want on a group trip or front country kitchen. I like the way it interlocks to pack small (and, more critically, more easy to find in the group kitchen tote common to many programs.) Small packing is the goal on kayak trips, so I love this compact toolkit. The addition of tongs is appreciated, too. I like stainless for program use much more than plastic, so another win.
review.name: Great for group trips and basecamps

review.reviewBody: I have skied with these boots for 2 seasons and found that once the boot was dialed in they are great. I had to heat treat the liner so my foot would be comfortable and warm. each season is about 60 to 70 days in these boots. from skiing to standing around and coaching and Ski touring. The touring mode gives a great range of motion. The 130 flex was idea for me and gave good feed back when skiing. Looking forward to getting another pair when these ones are done.
review.name: Great boot

review.reviewBody: I bought these 2 months ago and skied on them for two weeks now. They are the best fitting boots I ever owned without having them bootfitted. Highly recommended!

He said there wasn’t a cuff alignment on the boot. I’m am so dissatisfied and frustrated. With being in langes for over 20 years and skiing for over 45 years. I don’t recommend this boot to anyone
review.name: No cuff Alignment

review.reviewBody: Pretty cool jacket, love the 686 gore-tex gear. Super functional as far as pockets and user ability goes. By chance if you can grab one, do you wont be disappointed!

review.itemreviewed: Flyweight Access Wet Wading Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots don’t have enough traction. I wet wade for river smallmouth in Maryland and Virginia. These things just don’t give me a lot of stability in the river.
review.name: Not Grippy Enough

review.itemreviewed: Flyweight Access Wet Wading Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great shoe overall. Very happy. Light, good fit, great lacing system. Great for travel. Great grip on tough surfaces. Good for rocks, beach and boat. Support is good for a light shoe.
review.name: Very happy.

review.itemreviewed: Flyweight Access Wet Wading Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Thick sole on boots combined with absolutely ZERO ANKLE SUPPORT combines for a nice pair of ankle breakers. Obviously anglers are scrambling over rough, uneven terrain and it seems these were designed as if we’re always walking on even ground. Factor in weak lacing system, a pull through plastic piece that loosens throughout the day, that lets your foot start sliding around and the stability falls off even more. Why does it seem impossible to make a decent mf wet wading boot? Weird ankle cuffs need to be strangling tight to keep anything out. You can see where Simms was close but Im convinced there is 0 testing of prototypes in their process. There’s no way a set of anglers tested this and said this was the final design.
review.name: DO NOT PURCHASE  UNTIL YOU READ - too many shortcomings

review.itemreviewed: Flyweight Access Wet Wading Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought these to replace my old flats fishing boots. I wanted something light but that had more support and all day comfort compared to zip up boots... I like that these are really light and pretty easy to put on and take off quickly. Good traction on sand, rock, coral, etc. and comfortable! My feet felt great at the end of the day. The plastic on toe and heal did great job. There is no ankle support whatsoever (i knew this going in but it bears repeating). The shoes did pretty well keeping sand out. Because they're not proper flats boots, they definitely show some battle scars- worn and cut treads, worn spots and a couple tears on rest of shoe. I would want something more stout if I was fishing in nothing but sharp rock and coral. Overall I'm happy with them. I didn't give them 5 stars because I think they're considerably overpriced (like everything from Simms now) for what they are (but hey, i'm the sucker that bought them!)
review.name: pretty good choice for flats fishing

review.itemreviewed: Flyweight Access Wet Wading Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The M's Flyweight?? Access Wet Wading Shoe is a fantastic choice, receiving a well-deserved 5 out of 5 rating. These boots are not only awesome but also incredibly comfortable. The incorporation of a sock drawstring is a game-changer, effectively preventing stream debris from entering the boot.

On my initial wear, I found them to be exceptionally comfortable, providing excellent traction. These boots not only meet but exceed expectations. I highly recommend them for anyone in need of reliable, comfortable, and high-traction wet wading shoes.
review.name: Best wading boots!!

review.itemreviewed: Flyweight Access Wet Wading Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for wet wading, surf and flats fishing.  Got to try them out in the Keys between Christmas and New Years and they worked great, worn with neoprene socks.  Very comfortable and easy to walk in.
review.name: Surf, flats and wet wading!

review.itemreviewed: Flyweight Access Wet Wading Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I thought I would never find a flats boot that I liked as much as my old Patagonia Marlwalkers, long since discontinued.  So much so that I kept using them well beyond their useful life, until the soles finally fell off.  Finally forced to find another flats boot, I ran across these Flyweight Access boots and decided to give them a try.  Although not specifically marketed as a saltwater boot, I can say after returning from a recent trip to Turneffe Flats in Belize that these boots performed really, really well.  
Features that I liked:
-Easy on/off
-The laces cinch up tightly and easily 
-The elastic collar worked well to keep out the majority of the sand
-Very lightweight but still provided good ankle support 
-The sole is nicely rigid and held up well following quite a bit of wading in the rocks and coral
-My street shoe size is a 10; I bought these in an 11 to accommodate a thick neoprene sock and the overall fit is very good.
Minor complaints:
-The heel loop that is meant as an aid to pull them on could be larger making it much easier to actually place a finger into it.
-The “built-in lace garages” (the term they use to describe them) trap a lot of sand.  Not a big deal, just something to be aware of.  
Overall, I feel that these are a winning design that should last me for many years.
review.name: My new favorite flats boots!

review.itemreviewed: Flyweight Access Wet Wading Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm not one to write many reviews, but had to for these shoes...maybe for selfish reasons.  Simms has to keep these in production!  They are by far the most comfortable wading shoes I have ever worn.  As a fisheries professional, I go through several pairs of wading boots a year, and will continually come back to these.  They're great for wet-wading, or dry wading.  And especially good for use with a dry-suit...actually the only comfortable pair of dry suit boots that I've ever had.  Well done Simms!
review.name: Keep these in production!!

review.itemreviewed: Flyweight Access Wet Wading Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: They are beautiful shoes, except for they are too difficult to remove and to put on. Also ordered a full size 2 small.
review.name: Extremely difficult to put on and takeoff

review.itemreviewed: Flyweight Access Wet Wading Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I actually got these to hike “The Narrows “ in Zion National Park. They were excellent. Nothing but very large slippery rocks, sometimes boulders to climb on or around. Always in calf deep water and sometimes up to my waist. They never slipped, and they were incredibly lightweight and easy to maneuver in that very rigorous hike. Can’t wait to wade fish in them. THAT will be a piece of cake!
review.name: Excellent Boots

name: Flyweight Access Wet Wading Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Waterproof Cold Weather Knee Length Sock - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for a multi-day kayak tour in Alaska, and both leaked. Test them out before you go. Will not purchase again.
review.name: Junk

review.itemreviewed: Waterproof Cold Weather Knee Length Sock - Men's
review.reviewBody: I got there socks to wear under neoprene paddling shoes. I like a lauch my kayak from the beach. I walk it out into about a foot of water so that the hull doesn't get scratched up. I am only in the water a few minutes at a time. I bought these socks thinking I would have completely dry feet. My first outing the left foot stayed dry while the right sock had a little leakage. My second outing had both socks leaking as it they were not waterproof at all. I did rinse them uner a faucet and hang dried, so no washing machine damage. They do help to keep my feet warm, similar to a wetsuit. The sizing does seem a little on the large size. I do not recommend these as a dry sock.
review.name: Not a waterproof sock.

review.itemreviewed: Waterproof Cold Weather Knee Length Sock - Men's
review.reviewBody: I followed the sizing guide and the socks were huge on me.  Backcountry behaved well and allowed a payment free return with exchange.  I am awaiting the new smaller sized socks, order place 6 December.  Will update once they arrive.
review.name: Love the socks BUT way tooooo big

name: Waterproof Cold Weather Knee Length Sock - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Breeze Insect Shield + Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Insect Shield + Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] High quality packaging design. Very comfortable material used in the manufacturing. It's very durable and should last a very long time. Very easy to unpack and setup. It does a great job of helping defend you against insects.
review.name: Very durable and high quality

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Insect Shield + Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wow this mummy shield bag liner is amazing! Works excellently to keep out pests, smooth fabric keeps you cool at night and when it's humid. Strong and durable, very lightweight and packs up small and is easy to carry.
review.name: A must have for your summer camping needs

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Insect Shield + Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The product is Lightweight comfy pad, gives a great night's sleep.
Pros
• Lightweight
• Comfortable
• Easy and quick to inflate/deflate
• Packs down 

Cons
• A bit noisy on the tent floor
• The "bleed" valve is a little fussy at  times
review.name: Good for try

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Insect Shield + Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I went car camping this weekend and it was amazing! So small and compact and also kept me so warm. Easy to pack and use and very comfortable. I loved the product!
review.name: Just like the photo!

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Insect Shield + Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This liner is very comfortable and easy to wash.  I like the material and the insect protector it very nice . It is easy to pack 
And unpack. It's very lightweight and durable!
review.name: I like the material and insect protector

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Insect Shield + Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Though I haven't used it for a full cold weather camping night yet, I can tell this material will do very well in a sleeping bag. It is soft and frictionless, making it very comfortable even against bare skin. It is also moisture wicking and dries very fast, which is nice for this type of application. Since I own some pretty pricey sleeping bags, I'm happy to have this liner to help preserve and protect them. It is very well made and a great design. Folds into a very compact bag for travel and storage
review.name: Well thought out design. Great material

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Insect Shield + Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag liner is a handy thing. It's thin and soft. Large enough for my almost 6ft  husband to fit into with room the spare. This would be good to have for almost any season camping.
review.name: Handy

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Insect Shield + Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] While this is a liner for a sleeping bag I would definitely use it on its own in the summer where I am because it can get hot camping. The fabric is made to be cool wicking and the fiber is woven with the tencel to keep away mosquitoes. The liner can withstand about 30 washes for it still to be effective against bug repelling. I will only wash it a couple times a season so it should last quite a few seasons. I have a different brand mummy bag and the liner still fits inside nice. I also like that the bottom has a draw cord so I can easily wear it around the fire at the campsite. Both myself at 5'3 and my husband at 6'1 can fit into this liner comfortably. I am very excited to use this liner all season while camping. So far no bug bites after one night of use. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest review.
review.name: Great bug repellent liner

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Insect Shield + Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If you travel a lot and camp outdoors this is a game changer! It truly does keep out insects and is super comfortable. You can easily wash it and it’s super durable.
review.name: A must have

review.itemreviewed: Breeze Insect Shield + Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] soooo excited to recieve this from Influenster! I needed this for my backpacking setup!! I love the sea to summit brand & am so excited to continue to use this liner in my future camping trips. Comfortable & will be good for the slightly warmer weather. Great quality!!
review.name: YAY love it

name: Breeze Insect Shield + Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner

description: Buy the Blackburn Chicane Cage online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Chicane Cage
hasVariant.description: Buy the Blackburn Chicane Cage online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought a pair of these fifteen years ago for my Merckx Titanium road bike. They look as good today as when I first installed them. Lightweight, durable, and inexpensive, these cages are just about perfect. They also don't mar water bottles like aluminum cages, and the stainless steel is basically indestructible. 
The cages hold any water bottle very securely. 
They're not carbon or titanium, so there's no bling factor, but if you want a high quality cage that will last forever you won't find a better choice.   

Update 4/2022:  Cages still look like new 25 years later, about 80k miles.
review.name: A Classic: Sturdy, Durable, Non-Marring

name: Chicane Cage

review.reviewBody: Yes, it is thin as other said, but proper for athletic pursuits, not for sitting outside in the winter. I own the non-wool Buff beanies and they are great, but no blue to match my xc ski kit. So, I  bought this blue wool one. The problem is the fold at the edge of the cap, between the inner and outer material. When you put it on either the inside material is showing/ rolled to the outside or the outside material is rolled inside. I wish I knew this before I wore it as I would have returned it. Come on it’s a beanie, put on and go, not have to look into a mirror to get it looking proper. But I bet the hatless homeless person I give it to will love it! Maybe that was Buff’s demographic for this hat.
review.name: Not a fan

review.reviewBody: I was expecting light, but not paper thin material.
review.name: Paper thin
comment:
Hi there Megan! I am sorry to hear that the beanie was not to your expectations. Hopefully you can find something else that is able to work for you this season, our gearheads are always here to help with finding some awesome gear via phone or chat.

Thanks!
Sydney R.

review.reviewBody: This is a great lightweight beanie. It makes it really easy to adjust head coverage for more or less heat retention. Works great and is very light.  A helmet or another hat can fit over pretty well.
review.name: Perfect

name: Lightweight Merino Wool Beanie

I don’t like pants that have no stretch and these are perfect — soft with a bit of stretch. I have them in two colors so far.
review.name: Perfection

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I already have the Zoe pants and thought these might be redundant, but they’re not. They are a smidge more structured and therefore a little less casual with exactly the same comfort level. They are beautifully crafted out of butter soft fabric with a slight stretch. The color light khaki blends beautifully with the color of a natural linen blazer I own, making for a nicely coordinated outfit. I’m 5’4”, 130 lbs, straight up and down figure. I used the size calculator and the size 6 fits perfectly.
review.name: Perfect addition my line up!

review.reviewBody: Runs big. The color was much darker than I thought it would be
review.name: Pants

review.reviewBody: These are my new favorite pants! The green is perfect and I love the raw hem!
review.name: Fav pants!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and stylish, will get another color! Great piece for spring and summer
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: Love these pants! I’m 5’8” and usually wear a small or size 4. I ordered a 4 and they are perfect, with the perfect amount of extra room as pictured- not too tight. I ordered the green and the color seems slightly darker than the photo but still love them. I would consider buying another pair. Fabric is soft and good quality.
review.name: Just right

review.reviewBody: Love the color, the style, the cut -- super soft fabric. However they stretch sooo much when worn. I highly recommend ordering 1 size down. I typically wear size 12. The 10s are a great fit due to the stretching when worn.
review.name: Love them -- so soft -- order 1 size down

review.reviewBody: Love the color, they are somewhat brighter than most olive colored pants and so soft, but size 4 too big for me even though the same size fit in a different color! And too short.
review.name: Sizes are different in different colors

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Carve clothing fits me great-smaller waist than other brands, roomy in the thighs, though I wish they were a bit longer cause too short when you try to roll them up(I’m 5’5.5” but long legged). Also, not thrilled that same pants in another color were bigger.. more uniformity in this department please, Carve!
review.name: Love, but..

name: Sausolito Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: The boots construction is great and high quality, but I have a wide foot and even though they say they are wide sizes they hurt my toes and arches if worn for too long, and they squeeze my feet by the arches that make them uncomfortable to wear for extended periods of time. I still wear them but have to do it in short bursts or my feet will be hurting all day long, and even though they say wide and a half size big I will not be able to wear wool socks with them.
review.name: Not wide enough in wide sizes
comment:
Hello John,
We do not want these boots to hurt your feet.  We would recommend sizing up to see if that will help with the discomfort.  We want you to be satisfied with your purchase.  Please reach out to our support team so we can get this resolved. xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.reviewBody: Purchased these online without trying them on, thinking they would fit like the original legacy boots and was very surprised. The wider calf is pleasantly designed and allows for getting your pants tucked in. However that is where design benefits end. The boot tapers down and narrows excessively at the ankle where it feels tighter than the original legacy boots. The instep and volume of the boot is severely reduced and immediately caused pain and top of that, these are shorter than the original legacy boots in the same size. These might work for someone with flat, low volume feet but I immediately sent them back and given the characteristics, I don’t think they would work in a bigger size either.
review.name: Try them on first!
comment:
Hello KP,
Sorry you were not satisfied with your purchase.  Do not hesitate to reach out for assistant as we do offer a limited warranty.  Please email us at xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com.  Have a great day!

review.reviewBody:
TLDR: A well designed boot, superior to the regular 15” model, suitable for wide footed people, but with a few design drawbacks.

As a wide footed fisherman, I was excited to see Xtratuf finally coming out with a wider model after a few years of dealing with categorically inferior footwear from other manufacturers. These boots seem to be trying to fill the niche filled by the Legacy 2.0 that was discontinued for some reason a few years back. With some small but significant changes.

The boots are, as I said, wider then the narrow footed models and comfortably fit my excessively wide feet. I have yet to wear these on deck, but I wore then out for some long hikes and they didnt cause problems after 12 hours of continuous use. 
The body of the boot is reinforced with extra material in the toes, top of the arch, upper ankle/lower shin area, and the heel.
 The top is wider, accommodating large calves, making them faaar easier to put on and take off, and also providing ventilation for the inside of the boot. Leading to dryer feet.

Now the things I dont like:
 For whatever reason, xtratuf decided to make the boot slightly narrower then the 2.0’s mentioned earlier. There is some slight contact with the pinky toe for me, which over time could cause excessive wear and a hole to form in the boot. as well a a cold spot from conductive heat loss.
The positioning of the reinforcement material in the ankle area is… interesting, there is an 1” gap between the reinforcement on the upper ankle/shin and the one on the top of the boot body. These stiffer areas work to force the thinner strip to bend excessively, more so then in other models. An odd choice considering every single one of the rubber boots I’ve owned have failed because this exact area bends alot when you move, leading to a crease that eventually becomes a crack and then a hole. Time will tell, but this could be a serious flaw that causes the boots to become compromised faster then the regular, cheaper legacy’s.
And while I love the wider tops, Im disappointed they went with the flat too cut, instead of the downward sloping cut of the 2.0’s. This reduces the boots breathability. and could lead to an awkward condition where when you lean forward and backward in the boot, the flat top can slowly work your pants leg up from the back. Leading to the always fun discovery that your pants leg has been completely ejected from the boot and is now soaked in fish slime. The sloped cut never had this problem.

Ultimately though, despite these flaws, the boot is just categorically superior to the regular legacies. Check em out.
review.name: A solid boot, but with a few drawbacks

name: Legacy NXT Rain Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: So much to love about this, but I had to return it. Fabric is exceptional, and I love that it snaps instead of buttons. Beautiful colors. The problem is snaps are arranged at the top and below the breast so it gaps. Shirt wasn't tight or pulling; but just standing upright, there's a bubble window. Tried a larger size hoping that would solve it, but that was actually worse. It was so lose that it gapped the entire way down the shirt. Hoping this will be redesigned at some point with the snaps in more strategic places. If you're built like a boy, you should try it.

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for the days of snowboarding in less harsh weather.  I fleece under the jacket kept me perfectly warm down the runs.  The hoodie shape allows it to cover my helmet and outlines my face for protection from wind.
review.name: Excellent shell

review.reviewBody: Very lightweight, comfortable and warm. So streamlined that my wife didn’t think it would keep me warm, but actually the opposite. Love the color and accents, and the wrist gaiters are a great feature to keep our cold air and snow
review.name: Best jacket I have owned

review.reviewBody: Perfect ski jacket, keeps you warm while you're not overloaded with layers. Highly recommend
review.name: Light weight and effective

review.reviewBody: I am really enjoying this jacket this ski season. Bought at end of 2023 ski season. I am 6'-1" and 180lb and got a size Medium. Fit is snug but I wouldn't want a large as it would be too baggy. Probably not a lot of room for additional layers underneath besides a long underwear top but it keeps me plenty warm skiing in high teens and into the 20's. Only negative is the powder skirt doesn't really get tight enough to stay in place or keep the snow out in a good crash. Like the hand loops to keep the sleeves tucked into my gloves.
review.name: Warm jacket.

review.reviewBody: I agree with Justin Y. I bought the ‘22 version of the jacket. I wore it a few times during the winter of ‘22-‘23. Great fit, style and warmth. I wore it maybe 15-20 days during winter of ‘23. By the end of the season the stitching along the zippers was getting undone. Also had a rip in the shoulder without obvious contact with tree branches. I returned it. HH would not give me a new one as replacement because even though the jacket came fro Backcountry it was purchased through Amazon. I finished the season using my 16 year old Arcteryx sidewinder. If you truly want something that’s bulletproof, look no further than Arcteryx goretex shells.
review.name: Fragile indeed

review.reviewBody: A well fitting but fragile jacket. Unfortunately, the outer shell material is very thin/flimsy/fragile. A brush with a small tree left an entire arm panel ripped open (damage beyond the surface scratch). This was after only 3 days on the mtn. I have never owned another ski jacket that became damaged so easily. Once ripped, you can see the shell fabric is paper thin. This is a real bummer because the style and fit of the jacket is otherwise excellent. The collar is the best feature on this jacket. It stands up on its own when zipped up, rather than being floppy like some others. It cuts the wind and is just the right height. The hood is a bit small/tight over a helmet, but it seems to be a concession to not obstructing your side view which is a fair trade. The shell seems fully water and windproof for the few days I wore it. The jacket is a bit short for boarders bending down to strap in, but I had no issues when combined with bibs. The jacket itself is very warm. If you ski/ride only occasionally and run cold, this is an adequate choice. If you want a jacket to last many years, I'm not sure this is it.
review.name: A well fitting but fragile jacket.

review.reviewBody: Stays warm, is breathable, looks good. Love it!
review.name: Absolutely love it!

review.reviewBody: Was looking for new hooded shell for lift-access skiing. Bought a bunch to try on at home with layers, pants, and helmet. Almost kept this one, but it was just a litttttle too thick. I prefer to layer up/down depending upon weather. Great helmet-sized hood, and love the left forearm lift pass pocket. I've had two shells in 30 years, and next one needs to be perfect. This and the Patagonia Untracked came close. Great shell but returned.
review.name: Great Jacket, Just a Bit Too Thick

name: Alpha LifaLoft Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the LuminAID Solar String Light + Phone Charger online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Solar String Light + Phone Charger
hasVariant.description: Buy the LuminAID Solar String Light + Phone Charger online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this! They’re great portable lights and d they wind up nice and neat and it’s small enough to carry in your car. I hadn’t used the charging portion but my sister did and said it did a decent charge. I like all the different light settings and it looks super cute. Definitely buying more so I can string them along more things! Love the solar charging!
review.name: Beautiful solar lights!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Okay, I am officially obsessed with this fun little gadget. It charges your phone, it has a spotlight and a string light feature and is water resistant. It even has a red and red-blinking option for emergencies etc.. It’s super compact and easy and light to pack in anything. We used it in our tent and hung it up in the center to charge during the day and then turned the string lights on at night. It even seems to charge up in fairly low light although much more slowly. A genius idea! Love this thing!
review.name: Fun little multipurpose gadget

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Not only is this phone charger but it's a pretty string light that stretches pretty far ! The back also has 3 modes of a light .. the candle one is really pretty ! I love that you can charge it or solar charge it !
review.name: Great for camping !

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely LOVE this! The string lights are so easy to wrap and unwrap and really set the vibe wherever you place them. They are the perfect brightness. The solar light on it is great and then you have the added benefit of the phone charger. We use it while camping and it works great.
review.name: So worth it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These lights are so awesome. There are so many different light options for both the string lights & the base light. I love how much range the string lights cover. It is such an added bonus that you can charge your phone with this and the solar charger charges so fast.
review.name: The coolest string lights EVER!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great little solar light for camping. These lights are versatile and wonderful. One button controls the light on the back side of the device. The other button controls the string of lights and its 4 modes. During the day I let it charge in the sun and I have several hours of use in the evening. I highly recommend.
review.name: Brilliant design.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Luminaid solar string light with phone charger. I’m so impressed how this works great. It’s nice and bright love it and also it really do charge your phone.
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great for a family camping trip . Easy accessable and lights up quickly . It is multi use and charges my phone as well as lights up my tent.  Amazing experience and great for outdoor fun.
review.name: Durable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a really cool product. I love that you can charge your phone with it, as it always seems like something needs to be charged when we are camping or whatever. The case seems pretty durable and it’s small and easy to carry. I love that it has string lights too. It’s perfect for camping.
review.name: Perfect for camping

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These lights are brighter than I thought! Lasts all night! Charges super fast & easy! My son cannot wait to use this in his tent this summer . Easy to use!
review.name: Light it up!

name: Solar String Light + Phone Charger

review.reviewBody: Great kids boot, good product. The lacing system is poor design and not practical. The laces are sewn into the tongue at the ends and the adjustment is with the toggle. review.reviewBody: I decided to get a XS based on the sizing chart. I have to say it does run a bit smaller than expected so if you’re conflicted between 2 sizes, I would size up. Also I would wash it before using, since the dye stained my shirt under. I had 2 running vest before and I never had this problem and they were far more affordable than this vest. I don’t know if I got a defected one but I was disappointed this happened since the shirt was new as well. If this didn’t happen I would give it 4 stars since it did chaf my neck
review.name: Beware of staining shirt worn under the vest
comment: Hi. For any inconvenience, we apologize. We're happy to reassure you that a case has been opened to address your worries, and we're looking forward to hearing from you. Check your inbox!

review.reviewBody:
Light weight!! Plenty of storage!!
Feels great while running!!
review.name: Feels Great!!

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I was looking for in a running vest, fits amazing hardly notice your wearing it, game changer on  high mile runs, plenty of room to carry whatever accessories you need. Haven't had long enough to test the durability but its well made should last a long time. Highly recommend
review.name: Perfect running vest

review.reviewBody:
I have 5 Salomon packs ranging in different sizes for different adventures. This one broke after less than 1 month. The straps that hold the water bottles in broke. And the mesh front pocket is starting to wear already. 
Also, the top goes up higher in the neck than the ADV 5&12 I have. It is irritating for longer runs. But, that just might be me.
review.name: Didn’t last
comment: We are sorry to hear that your Active Skin 12 did not meet your expectations. At Salomon, we strive to provide high-quality products that deliver exceptional performance and durability. We appreciate your feedback and have reached out to you to take a further look into your concerns.

review.reviewBody:
Love this purchase… super comfy and has been a great piece of gear for my long runs. 
Only drawback is o wish the front pocket had a bit more room to store my phone
review.name: Super comfy

review.reviewBody: No bouncing during the run, easy to access the pockets, easy to use the water bottles, super light you can’t even feel it, highly recommended for trail runners
review.name: Great design

review.reviewBody: I have used this on several 100km runs and there is plenty of space for food and any required clothing / medical kit /etc.  I have also added the extra water bladder in the back and it's perfect.  My one complaint is that the two water bottles it came with seem to have teats that come off too easily.  On my last race, I went to have a drink whilst running and the teat came off and fell onto the trail, I couldn't find it and the bottle was now useless for the rest of the race (thankfully it wasn't too hot).  Salomon do better bottles - use them when selling this and don't give us these cheap ones!
review.name: Great all rounder for ultra running, but...

review.reviewBody: I’ve tried a few different running brand vests and have to say, this is by far the most practical/comfortable one I’ve had. It’s slimline, fits against the body nice and the pockets are placed well for sipping from bottles as you run. Would highly recommend.
review.name: Smart running vest

review.reviewBody: Very light and comfortable. Stowage space is perfect and accessible.
review.name: Excellent running vest

review.reviewBody: Durable, colour matches picture, fits snug and comfortably
review.name: Durable!

name: Active Skin 12L Hydration Vest Set

review.reviewBody: This is one of the very last medium duty soft boots that you can buy for true nordic telemark. If you know what a true nordic ski is for, you will love this boot, particularly if you select the correct ski and binding combo. Boot fits as expected. I have a wide heal annd flat arches and it is still very comfortable. I want to warn people that this boot is not for hard core telemark use, as it this is specifically for comfort on long backcountry trips, not for pounding the down hill runs. Hard use can rip the sole from the boot.
review.name: Great boot, super comfortable and warm.

review.reviewBody: I use these boots at the resorts and in the back country. There not made for anything beefer than the Voile HD mountaineering 3 pin binding. If you use other bindings like the switchback or similar you might separate the toe from the boot. I ski very aggressive and hard in my boots over 100 days a season and never have had any issues. I usually get 2 seasons out of them before they get worn out. Although my wife has had the same pair for 7 years now and still working fine. So, it depends how much and how hard you use them. I highly recommend this boot to any good telemark 3 pin skier who skis in leather boots.
review.name: Great Boot

review.reviewBody:
Th=ere are so few good 75mm boots out there anymore. They were very comfortable and I had great hopes. Unfortunately in the Grand Teton Back country both toes gave out. One separated from the leather. The other cracked at the base of the toe piece opening the toe area to snow and ice,  I was not subjecting these to monster turns or anything unordinary. It was a long cold day back out.  

Contacted Alpina and they refused to do anything since they were just past the warranty period.  Seemed like a great boot but they failed due to manufacturing inadequacies.  These boots were probably used 12 times. Not happy with Alpina.
review.name: Blew out both toes
comment: An obvious defect on an otherwise great boot.  Now I'm NOT going to buy these boots, until and unless they take care of you, and you can and should tell them that.  I have a pair of these that I've put maybe 20 hours on and they've been great (bought about 18 months ago), and was about to buy another pair as backup in case they stop making them.  So.. this 2nd pair would get little use until who knows when. I need to know that even if I've had the boot for several years, if I just put a few hours on it (which is easy for a manufacturer to tell by looking at the boot) and it blows apart, that they will take care of me... as this is clearly a quality control issue.  There is ZERO excuse for this. These are not cheap boots.  They should not only replace your boots for free, they should also be bending over backwards for you since you were basically stuck in the back-country.   This is very disappointing to me.  Please reply to this email if you can get through to them.  Otherwise, I'm not only skipping out on this pair of boots, but ditching Alpina from this point forward, and that's too bad, because I've purchased over 15 pairs of their boots in my life-time so far, and am very active in the back-country ski community.   Good luck and sorry about your experience.
You definitely should contact them again.

name: Alaska 75mm Backcountry Boot - 2025

description: Buy the Abus BORDO BIG XPlus Alarm 6000KA Lock online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: BORDO BIG XPlus Alarm 6000KA Lock
hasVariant.description: Buy the Abus BORDO BIG XPlus Alarm 6000KA Lock online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Regret buying this monster. Not only is it huge and difficult to fit on my bike, but it weighs a ton. Wish I could return it.
review.name: Big AND Heavy

review.reviewBody:
Unfortunately, the long length of this item when mounted won't fit my bike frame. It seems like a great lock, especially the alarm function, but it is heavy and not a good candidate to just carry on a rack bag. Keep in mind that, despite the quoted dimensions, you also need a few inches to disengage it from the mount. That's where the problem lies. It's just too big for many bikes.

Also unfortunately, it comes with two methods of mounting: to the water bottle mounts or with included zip ties. The instructions to mount it to the water bottle mounts instructs you to cut off the rubber tabs used for the zip tie approach, and I did that. Now I can't return it and honestly, I think that is unfair. 

Note also that the mount is designed for a typical round tube, no options for a wider tube like on most newer bikes.
review.name: Requires a lot of frame

name: BORDO BIG XPlus Alarm 6000KA Lock

hasVariant.name: Urbanize NTA Mips Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the Lazer Urbanize NTA Mips Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love this helmet, but I definitely have a 59cm head (supposedly lower end of the L sizing) and the L size is not even close to fitting. I have to squeeze it into my head to the point that it's painful, and there is no room for even 1 click of the adjuster. Tried the ratcheting fitter inside the helmet too and only slightly helped, but still really tight. It's so bad I can only guess that they accidentally shipped M's out (or even S? it fit my girlfriend well) with L labelling, or the measurements are just not tested. Too bad because I was super excited for it.
review.name: Lovely helmet, if it can fit!

name: Urbanize NTA Mips Helmet
