description: Buy the Garmin Edge 540 Bike Computer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Edge 540 Bike Computer
hasVariant.description: Buy the Garmin Edge 540 Bike Computer online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: As far as the unit goes, it takes too many button presses to make it fluid. Also the screen is too small to be functional for bad eyesight. Luckily it didn’t cost me anything. I would purchase on my own. Would rather use my phone and trail forks app than downloading and having to save all the trails. With as much technology that is available today, it looks like an outdating gaming system for graphics.
review.name: Features are fine. Need a larger screen.

review.reviewBody: a great improvement, love the displace and battery life. so many features I haven't tried yet and so many I noticed on a ride and exclaim it can do that.  Looking forward to a connecting to a group ride. a little learning curve over my last Garmin I had for the past 7 years.
review.name: love the displace

review.reviewBody:
I only used Garmin products for 40 years. I am super happy with the Edge 540.
It works great with the radar light on the back of my bike, which is a Garmin. 
I recommend having the Veria RTL515 radar and tail light. This is a big game changer.
review.name: Garmin edge 540.

review.reviewBody: I bought this a few weeks ago and it is the best! I am totally enjoying it.
review.name: Great Performance

review.reviewBody: Like the additional features, don't like the new interface menu or the small font used in different windows.  The 530 I thought was a little more logical and practical to use and navigate.
review.name: Mixed good and bad

review.reviewBody: only used it twice, so far I love it. I do want to chance the display function to have how many miles I have in the forefront. the default is my speed. just a preference
review.name: Awesome bike computer

review.reviewBody: It has it all however it is a bit complicated to navigate. Kind of like toooo much in a small unit.
review.name: Great unit

review.reviewBody:
Just bought the Edge 540 to replace my 530 which replaced my 520. I've liked each of them but find they reach a point where the battery is lacking and isn't easily replaceable. Setting up the 540 was easy due to the ability to simply scan a code and virtually all my data was saved to the new 
unit. As with the 530, this unit connects to my Orbea Rise E mountain bike which provides precise info about battery range and usage. There are new screen layout options, the unit reacts more quickly and GPS is more accurate. Battery life is expected to be much improved as well. Aside from that, I've always appreciated the size and appearance of these units.
review.name: Connectivity to Mountain Bike

review.reviewBody: Still learning but  complicated for me. But will learn
review.name: Helpful when riding

review.reviewBody: The 540 has the same issue that the 520 had.  The buttons are far too hard to push.  Seems like Garmin could have worked that out by now.  Other than that it's a great unit and so far I really like it.
review.name: Great, except...

name: Edge 540 Bike Computer

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my daughter to carry her phone & snacks on rides. On the first use the cord that secures the top of the water bottle came unstitched where it connects to the hip pack, but Competitive Cyclist was very easy to work with to get it replaced. Subtracted one star for that. We have been on a couple of rides with it since and it seems to be holding up well. It is a small pack but has enough room for a phone, keys, multi-tool and a few snacks. I'm sure you could fit an inflator and a couple of CO2 cartridges as well. I used it myself on one ride and it is comfortable and stays in place well.
review.name: Great Little Hip Pack

review.reviewBody: Bit the bullet and returned to the fanny pack set after a 30 year hiatus. Efficient and Fashionable, what else is there to say? This pack is relatively small capacity- room for a small repair kit, compact first aid bag, and a few snacks. Haven't tried the water bottle holder. I will say that i'm a 32 waist and there isn't a whole lot of extra belt left.
review.name: Fanny Pack Convert.

review.reviewBody:
Lots of reviews mention the hip belt is too small but Dakine must have updated it. I'm a size 36 waist and mine fits with plenty of room to spare!

Love the bag overall for intermediate length rides and just going to the park with my kids. It's lightweight so I forget it's there but holds just enough stuff
review.name: Updated!

review.reviewBody: Sturdy bag but the belt could be longer of have an extension added. Still with that a good reliable bag worthy of purchase.
review.name: Great for short trips

review.reviewBody: The pack is well made but very small; I don't think it could hold a 0.5L bottle. The belt is kiddie size. Unless your waist is under 28", it won't fit.
review.name: tiny pack and belt

review.reviewBody:
Yep, I'm in my mid 50's and am a 200 lb. 5'10" guy with a 36" waist.  I measured the circumference of the strap and it's exactly 36". Too tight for me.  If you plan on wearing this over clothes not just spandex subtract more inches.

Bought this Hot Laps 1L and the Hot Laps Stealth at the same time.  The Stealth has some extra reach (42") so I'll set up with a road repair kit as planned.  Won't set up the 1L for MTB repair kit, since it doesn't fit.

$7 to return.  Will see if a younger skinnier member of the family can use it, but a "fanny" pack isn't cool these days.

Dakine or Backcountry should list waist sizes.
review.name: For the Skinny, need to list waist size

review.reviewBody: This is a great quality pack for a moderate ride and love how compact it is. Would give it 5 stars but the waist strap is a little small, can dig into you side.
review.name: Great Pack!

name: Hot Laps 1L Hip Pack

review.reviewBody: Perfect for hitting the river when you want to go light. Waterproof for phone etc. A hip pack designed by fisherman. If had a suggestion it would be to make the bottle pouch a bit larger in diameter. My Yeti 24oz Rambler is a bit tight. First world problems... :)
review.name: Nicely done.

review.reviewBody: Nice product and well built. Hope Simms can make one a bit bigger in the future. This bag also seems to prevent falling in the river to fully test it waterproof integrity.  But been through plenty rainstorms and wet days to test fully. Cheers.
review.name: Fanny pack

review.reviewBody: Waterproof, outstanding quality and functional design.
review.name: YES really waterproof

review.reviewBody: Just did my first flats trip with the pack, it held everything I needed for a grand slam and kept my phone and wallet dry in some rainy and windy conditions. Definitely a better pack than my last one, the dry zipper is genius!
review.name: Great pack for all conditions. .

review.reviewBody: Great pack! I’ve had mine for a few years now and it has always been nice to have. My only suggestion to buyers is to get the new model or buy a belt net holder.
I like the size it holds the boxes I need to carry, I have found I prefer the waist pack over my sling, I find it easier for access
Nice hip pack, waterproof, big storage pocket for multiple fly boxes, gear, etc.  very comfortable.
review.name: Dry Creek Hip Pack

review.reviewBody: Just what I was looking for to carry gear while I walked the beach sight fishing!
review.name: Great addition to my fishing gear

review.reviewBody: Great at being water proof. Room inside is plentiful. Would have enjoyed separators to help organize contents but it works well and easy to use!
review.name: Very functional

review.reviewBody: It's a nice tackle bag waterproof and everything like that comfortable to wear but the main zipper is a little hard to open
review.name: Nice fishing tackle bag

name: Dry Creek Z 8L Hip Pack

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of these and loved them so much I bought a second. Both broke by very minor bumps to them, it was actually quite shocking for glasses this expensive. I love the style, but so worried to buy them again. I may try the steel frames.
review.name: Look Great - Extremely fragile

review.reviewBody: I have worn low downs for years and usually love them. I recently repurchased the Lowdown which was too small. So I ordered the XL’s which are also too small somehow and give me a headache (my head isn’t that large), the material feels cheap and has a weird texture, and the lense has a slight wave in it so the vision is worse and makes me slightly disoriented. The cloth bag it comes in is also stiff and a weird texture, unlike any microfiber case I’ve seen. Normally a big fan of Smiths -not sure what happened with these shades. Would love a refund.
review.name: Used to love these

review.reviewBody: Excellent exactly what I wanted, and performs perfectly
review.name: Excellent exactly what I wanted,

review.reviewBody:
The fit and comfort of the SMITH helmet is excellent.
I highly recommend SMITH products.
review.name: The fit and comfort of

review.reviewBody: Bad reflection from the inside of the lens from the purlpe tint of the chromapop from the sun. The nose rubber slips and slides anytime there is sweat - they don't fit well with a hat either. I wish I could have returned but I have worn them a few times so I can't.
review.name: Eric N

review.reviewBody:
In love with the lowdown 2 XL! The chromapop lense really provides intense, vivid color to everything around me. 
The best!
review.name: Lowdown 2 XL

review.reviewBody: Excellent sunglasses. Initially purchased the black chromapop ones, but wasnt a fan as the lens was too blue rather than black. I thought it would be more like the black lens on the performance sunglasses (smith shifts). Returned and got the green chromapop lens and WOW they so good, it looks better than my naked eyesight tnh. Colors truly pop with this lens and they look great. Maybe a bit expensive for what they are but very nice nevertheless
review.name: nice

review.reviewBody: Insane clarity. Great fit for big head. Lightweight build
review.name: Insane clarity. Great fit for

review.reviewBody: Nice glasses for a large face in width, but too far down in length. then had to pay shipping to return, so basically had to pay that fee for an item we didn't use. Not a great experience.
review.name: Too long on large face

review.reviewBody: My second pair of Lowdowns. Best sunglasses I’ve ever had!
review.name: My second pair of Lowdowns.

hasVariant.name: Utopia Breeze Beach Sling Chair
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Utopia Breeze Beach Sling Chair online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I ordered 4 of these so the kids would have seating as well, they are perfect for the beach.  I also love how they fold up so easily to be stored in their cases, which have a sling and can be carried over my shoulder like a bag.  We enjoyed using these at the beach very much!
review.name: Great for the beach

review.reviewBody: Great chairs.  Lightweight.  Beachy colors.  Sturdy.
review.name: Great Beach Chairs

review.reviewBody: Great beach chair.  Light, comfortable and easy to pack for traveling.  First week of heavy beach use and very satisfied so far.
review.name: Perfect portable beach chair

review.reviewBody: This chair is comfortable and easy to carry. The compact design makes it great for travel.
review.name: Beach sling chair

review.reviewBody: I bought two of these chairs and they were great at first but after using them maybe 10 times the back rest started to stretch enough that my back was resting on the rear cross supports.  This was very uncomfortable so I stopped using them.  I have always had good luck with Coleman products but can't really recommend these.  I may give the red Steel deck chair a go but reluctant.
review.name: Not that comfortable
comment: We're sorry to hear that our Utopia Breeze™ Beach Sling Chair isn't living up to your expectation. If you need further assistance you may email using the contact form on our website.

review.reviewBody: Love this chair for sitting by the ocean!!  So glad I ordered it - reasonable, well built and comfortable!!
review.name: Perfect beach chair!!

review.reviewBody: This is a great chair, however after 1 day at the ocean I was unable to collapse these chairs. Many different people tried with no luck. This was very frustrating bc I purposely bought these to save space in the car and they were not cheap! Very disappointing! Considering it’s a beach chair it should be designed to not get sand in it.
review.name: Won’t collapse
comment: Hi there, We can see why you would be upset especially when your expectations were not met in terms of durability and quality of our Coleman Chair. We sincerely apologize for what happened. Allow us to discuss more about why it won't collapse and your feedback will help us make our product better. Please call us at 1-800-835-3278, Monday - Friday from 9:00 am - 5:00 pm EST and we'll be happy to help.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Needed a well built beach chair & found it! They look great and very functional.
review.name: Great beach chair! Love it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great packable beach chair! Bringing to Florida over Christmas!
review.name: Utopia Breeze Beach Sling Chair

name: Utopia Breeze Beach Sling Chair
